title: Facebook ends funding for U.S. news partnerships program
text: Meta Platforms says it will no longer pay U.S. news organizations to have their material appear in Facebook's News Tab as it reallocates resources in the face of the economic downturn and changing user behavior.

title: Instagram Pauses On Some TikTok-Like Changes—For Now—After Complaints
text: Instagram will temporarily pause some new changes to the social media platform that made it more like competitor TikTok, Instagram chief Adam Mosseri told journalist Casey Newton on Thursday, after the planned changes drew widespread backlash from users of the app—including from major creators li

title: F.T.C. Chair Lina Khan Upends Antitrust Standards by Suing Meta
text: Lina Khan may set off a shift in how Washington regulates competition by filing cases in tech areas before they mature. She faces an uphill climb.

title: Meta's Q2 Earnings: Is It Really A Disaster?
text: Following Meta's Q2 earnings announcement, the stock price of the largest social media conglomerate plunged by more than 8%. Meta generated revenues of about $28.82 billion, down 1% as compared to Q2. Analysts had expected revenue of $28.92 billion.

title: Facebook ends funding for US news partnerships program
text: Meta Platforms says will no longer pay U.S. news organizations to have their material appear in Facebook's News Tab as it reallocates resources in the face of the economic downturn and changing user behavior.

title: Meta Platforms' (META) Q2 Earnings Lag Mark, Revenues Down Y/Y
text: Meta Platforms' (META) second-quarter 2022 performance suffers from lower advertising spending.

title: Why Meta Platforms Stock Crashed on Thursday
text: The social media giant's financial results left much to be desired.

title: FTC Antitrust Lawsuit Adds to Meta Platforms' META Stock Woes
text: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) is downtrodden today. The META stock is suffering at the hands of a poor earnings season.

title: Meta Platforms falls 9% after registering its first quarterly revenue drop in history as it still reels from Apple privacy change
text: "We seem to have entered an economic downturn that will have a broad impact on the digital advertising business," CEO Mark Zuckerberg said.

title: ETFs in Focus After Meta's First-Ever Revenue Drop
text: Meta Platform reported its first-ever quarterly drop in revenues and provided a gloomy forecast given the broader fallout in digital advertisement.

title: Meta Platforms: Silver Lining For Patient Investors
text: Meta's earnings report shows a bright spot in terms of the minimal negative impact of Apple's new privacy policies. In the earlier earnings call, Meta's management estimated $10 billion hit on revenue due to these privacy policies.

title: FTC Lawsuit Shows Faith in Meta's Trillion-Dollar Metaverse Ambitions
text: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) just sued to block Meta from acquiring a VR company, saying it would put the social media giant “one step closer to its ultimate goal of owning the entire ‘Metaverse.

title: Meta Platforms stock plunges after 2Q earnings miss and gloomy 3Q forecast
text: Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB) shares took a dive on Thursday following its disappointing 2Q results that saw the company post its first-ever revenue decline. The firm's profits fell during the second quarter as the social media giant faced a drop in advertising revenue thanks to rising inflation and a loss in digital ad revenue,with earnings per share (EPS) of US$2.46 versus consensus estimates of $2.54.

title: Meta shares fall following disappointing earnings
text: Shares of Meta fell 8% on Thursday, a day after the company released second quarter earnings that missed on the top and bottom lines.

title: Meta Lost Billions Building the Metaverse. Why Wall Street Is Still Upbeat on It.
text: The social media company's Reality Labs segment, focused on augmented and virtual reality, notched a $2.8 billion loss in the latest quarter.

title: Meta: Deeply Undervalued After Earnings Bloodbath
text: Meta Platforms ( META , Financial), formerly known as Facebook, recently announced its financial results for the second quarter of 2022. The company reported poor results and missing analysts' estimates for both revenue and earnings.

title: Steel Dynamics CEO Says His Steel Is More High-Tech Than Facebook
text: Steel Dynamics CEO Mark Millett co-founded the company. But he started out as a ski bum.

title: Meta Q2 Results: Disappointing Is An Understatement
text: Meta Platforms is the world's leading social media company. Meta missed on revenue, EPS, and guidance in its latest results, adding to shareholder woes after a terrible beginning to 2022.

title: Meta Platforms: Down But Not Out
text: META has attributed its Q2 earnings slump to brewing macro headwinds, but that's not the only headache for the company. META is also dealing with a slew of idiosyncratic ad snags, spanning Apple's privacy policy changes, competition, choppy engagement, and a potential dilution of focus due to its metaverse ambitions.

title: Meta Platforms Reports First-Ever Revenue Drop. Should You Sell The Stock?
text: The Facebook parent is combatting more headwinds than it can handle.

title: 7 Stocks to Buy on the Dip
text: The U.S. equities market remains in a dip no matter how you define it. Year-to-date, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is off by 12%.

title: Meta Takes A Big European Hit
text: Meta's European revenue has dropped roughly double-digits YoY. The company continues to face the risk of a market downturn. Reality Labs continues to cost the company >$10 billion annualized, it's something Facebook can afford, but returns someday would be nice.

title: Meta is ‘fighting its Cerberus' but the big picture is brighter for Facebook parent
text: Beneath Meta Platforms Inc.'s macroeconomic clouds is an existential crisis for the Facebook parent company that was on display when the technology giant delivered its latest results.

title: Global stocks rally as investors scent a Fed shift on tightening, but US futures sag after Meta earnings miss
text: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg warned of an economic downturn after the Facebook parent's second-quarter revenue and earnings missed targets.

title: FTC puts a dent in Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse dreams by suing to stop Meta buying a VR fitness app
text: The FTC argues Meta would be illegally eliminating competition if it is allowed to acquire VR fitness app Supernatural.
